title: National Day of Prayer, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump designating May 1, 2025, as the National Day of Prayer. It emphasizes the historical significance of prayer in America, tracing its roots from the First Continental Congress to contemporary times. The proclamation highlights the role of faith in American unity, strength, and morality, citing examples from American history, including the prayers of George Washington and the impact of prayer during national crises.

Trump underscores his administration's commitment to religious freedom and the eradication of anti-religious bias, mentioning the establishment of Task Forces and the White House Faith Office. He reflects on a personal experience of survival from an assassination attempt, viewing it as divine intervention meant to guide him in restoring the nation.

The proclamation calls on all Americans to observe this day with prayer and reflection, acknowledging the importance of faith in the nation's past, present, and future. The document serves as a reminder of the foundational role of prayer in American society and encourages collective observance across communities.
